connector.description: Exchanges messages with an IBM i system using data queues, message queues, or program call. IBM i is the replacement for AS/400 and iSeries servers.

camel.sink.path.userID.name: camel.sink.path.userID
camel.sink.path.userID.description: Returns the ID of the IBM i user.

camel.sink.path.password.name: camel.sink.path.password
camel.sink.path.password.description: Returns the password of the IBM i user.

camel.sink.path.systemName.name: camel.sink.path.systemName
camel.sink.path.systemName.description: Returns the name of the IBM i system.

camel.sink.path.objectPath.name: camel.sink.path.objectPath
camel.sink.path.objectPath.description: Returns the fully qualified integrated file system path name of the target object of this endpoint.

camel.sink.path.type.name: camel.sink.path.type
camel.sink.path.type.description: Whether to work with data queues or remote program call One of: [DTAQ] [PGM] [SRVPGM] [MSGQ]

camel.sink.endpoint.ccsid.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ccsid
camel.sink.endpoint.ccsid.description: Sets the CCSID to use for the connection with the IBM i system.

camel.sink.endpoint.format.name: camel.sink.endpoint.format
camel.sink.endpoint.format.description: Sets the data format for sending messages. One of: [text] [binary]

camel.sink.endpoint.guiAvailable.name: camel.sink.endpoint.guiAvailable
camel.sink.endpoint.guiAvailable.description: Sets whether IBM i prompting is enabled in the environment running Camel.

camel.sink.endpoint.keyed.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyed
camel.sink.endpoint.keyed.description: Whether to use keyed or non-keyed data queues.

camel.sink.endpoint.searchKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.searchKey
camel.sink.endpoint.searchKey.description: Search key for keyed data queues.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.outputFieldsIdxArray.name: camel.sink.endpoint.outputFieldsIdxArray
camel.sink.endpoint.outputFieldsIdxArray.description: Specifies which fields (program parameters) are output parameters.

camel.sink.endpoint.outputFieldsLengthAr.name: camel.sink.endpoint.outputFieldsLengthArray
camel.sink.endpoint.outputFieldsLengthAr.description: Specifies the fields (program parameters) length as in the IBM i program definition.

camel.sink.endpoint.procedureName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.procedureName
camel.sink.endpoint.procedureName.description: Procedure name from a service program to call

camel.sink.endpoint.secured.name: camel.sink.endpoint.secured
camel.sink.endpoint.secured.description: Whether connections to IBM i are secured with SSL.

camel.component.jt400.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.jt400.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.jt400.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.jt400.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.jt400.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.jt400.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.jt400.connectionPool.name: camel.component.jt400.connectionPool
camel.component.jt400.connectionPool.description: Default connection pool used by the component. Note that this pool is lazily initialized. This is because in a scenario where the user always provides a pool, it would be wasteful for Camel to initialize and keep an idle pool.
